SMW Subobject for (1)Examine: An enchanted teleportation crystal.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Teleport crystalUses infobox: ItemImage: File:Teleport crystal (1).pngWeight: 0.001Value: 15Version anchor: (1)Release date: 19 July 2005Item ID: 6102

A teleport crystal is a small crystal which can teleport a player to the elven village of Lletya (and Prifddinas upon completion of the Song of the Elves quest). Both teleports are reasonably close to a bank, and the Lletya teleport is close to a fruit tree patch and an altar.

The crystal has four teleport charges when initially received and, when used up, becomes a crystal teleport seed. It can then be recharged by Eluned for 150–750 coins; however she will only do this if it is out of charges and claims that she can only grant three charges due to her not being as skilled as the original enchanter. However, after the completion of the Hard Western Provinces Diary, she will enchant crystals to 5 charges. Players may possess multiple teleport crystals at the same time. After the completion of the Song of the Elves quest, crystals can be charged by Eluned in southwest Prifddinas or by Elven scout at Eluned's former locations.

Crystal teleport seeds can be obtained as a common drop from Elf warriors and Elf guards. Note that these are only dropped by the elves found in Lletya and Prifddinas, as the elves in the Iorwerth Camp will not drop it. Players are also required to at least have started Mourning's End Part I, though 50 Thieving is not required to obtain it. Elf warriors may drop it with one charge or no charges at all.

Players can craft an eternal teleport crystal to allow unlimited teleports.

Recharge # Cost
1st 750
2nd 600
3rd 450
4th 300
5th and thereafter 150

For an exhaustive list of all known sources for this item, see here (include RDT).

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
25 July 2019
(update)

The "Activate" option was replaced with "Lletya" and "Prifddinas" options.

31 August 2017
(update)

Partially charged versions of the item could now be turned into bank placeholders.

5 March 2015
(update | poll)

The teleport crystal now holds up to 5 charges if you have completed the Hard Western Provinces Diary.

20 June 2013
(update | poll)

As of this update you can now recharge all your elven teleport crystals in one easy step. Simply find Eluned and she’ll offer you the option to recharge them all in one go (subject to you having the right amount of coinage).

22 February 2013
(update)

This content was included when the Old School RuneScape servers officially launched.

[[File:Teleport crystal detail.png|left|100px]]
A '''teleport crystal''' is a small [[crystal]] which can teleport a player to the elven village of [[Lletya]] (and [[Prifddinas]] upon completion of the [[Song of the Elves]] quest). Both teleports are reasonably close to a [[bank]], and the [[Lletya]] teleport is close to a [[fruit tree patch]] and an [[altar]].

The crystal has four teleport charges when initially received and, when used up, becomes a [[crystal teleport seed]]. It can then be recharged by [[Eluned]] for 150–750 coins; however she will only do this if it is out of charges and claims that she can only grant three charges due to her not being as skilled as the original enchanter. However, after the completion of the [[Western Provinces Diary#Hard|Hard Western Provinces Diary]], she will enchant crystals to 5 charges. Players may possess multiple teleport crystals at the same time. After the completion of the Song of the Elves quest, crystals can be charged by Eluned in southwest Prifddinas or by [[Elven scout]] at Eluned's former locations.

Crystal teleport seeds can be obtained as a common drop from [[Elf warrior]]s and [[Elf guard]]s. Note that these are only dropped by the elves found in [[Lletya]] and [[Prifddinas]], as the elves in the [[Iorwerth Camp]] will '''not''' drop it. Players are also required to at least have started [[Mourning's End Part I]], though 50 [[Thieving]] is not required to obtain it. Elf warriors may drop it with one charge or no charges at all.

Players can craft an [[eternal teleport crystal]] to allow unlimited teleports.
